availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lawrence Strother Trimble (Paducah congressman, state representative, criminal court judge, and lawyer)

body.p: A Paducah, Kentucky lawyer, state representative, and congressman. Born in Fleming County, Kentucky. Son of James Trimble and Harriet Tripplet. Residence: Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky. Established a law practice in Paducah shortly after moving there in 1847. Elected to the Kentucky state legislature in 1851. Elected president of the New Orleans and Ohio Railroad, 1853. Elected Criminal Judge of the First Judicial District in 1856. Elected to Congress as a Democrat in 1865.

bibl.p: Ancestry.com, "Lawrence Strother Trimble," in The Biographical Directory of the United States Congress, 1774-2005.
The Biographical Encyclopedia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century (Cincinnati, OH: J.M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 167.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah, District 2, p. 97.
